member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SIPLACEProPath
member.summary:
The custom property which must be set on the ISA 95 object to identify the SIPLACE Pro object via the path string.
The SiplaceObjectType and the SIPLACEProPath must be set together to identify the object.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SIPLACEProObjectType
member.summary:
The custom property which must be set on the ISA 95 object to identify the SIPLACE Pro object type via the string. Currently 'Line', 'Station', 'Printer' and 'GenericLineDevice' are supported.
The SIPLACEProObjectType and the SIPLACEProPath must be set together to identify the object. Setting the SIPLACEProDBId is optional.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.CheckSIPLACEProPath
member.summary: This property tells the Service Locator to use the SIPLACE Pro Path properties for a search of the ISA 95 object first.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SIPLACEProOID
member.summary:
The custom property which must be set on the ISA 95 object to identify the SIPLACE Pro object via the object id.
The SIPLACEProOID_Long and the SIPLACEProDBId must be set together to identify the object. If only one database is used in a factory, the SIPLACEProDBId is optional!

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SIPLACEProOID_Long
member.summary:
The custom property which must be set on the ISA 95 object to identify the SIPLACE Pro object via the object id.
The SIPLACEProOID_Long and the SIPLACEProDBId must be set together to identify the object. If only one database is used in a factory, the SIPLACEProDBId is optional!

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SIPLACEProDBId
member.summary:
The custom property which must be set on the ISA 95 object to identify the SIPLACE Pro database via the database guid.
The SIPLACEProOID_Long and the SIPLACEProDBId must be set together to identify the object. If only one database is used in a factory, the SIPLACEProDBId is optional!

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.CheckSIPLACEProOID
member.summary: This property tells the Service Locator to use the SIPLACE Pro object id properties for a search of the ISA 95 object first.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.CustomProperties
member.summary: The Dictionary can contain a list of name value pairs which describe the properties which must match the ISA95 model

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.CheckCustomProperties
member.summary: This property tells the Service Locator to use the SIPLACE Pro object id properties for a search of the ISA 95 object first.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.DoNotReturnDefaultServices
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the FindServices method should return services which are not assigned to an ISA95 object. So in case custom properties or SIPLACE Pro details are provided and no assigned service is found, the following logic is true: In case DoNotReturnDefaultServices is true, an empty collection is returned, otherwise a list of all Services that match the rest of the SearchCriteria (ServiceName, ServiceVersion, Product, Grouped, Endpoint) by filtering for unconfigured services is returned.
member.value: true if [do not return default services]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.ConfigurationToStartWithSearching
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration (OID of Factory Layout Element - Isa95Object) to start with searching.
member.value: The configuration to start with searching.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SearchForEndpointSubstring
member.summary: If this is set to true and the Endpoint property is set as well, the following logic is applied: Only services will be returned where one of the MexEndpoints contain the Endpoint provided as sub-string (case invariant comparison is done).

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Business.Objects.ServiceMatchCriteria.SearchForHealthCheckEndpointSubstring
member.summary: If this is set to true and the HealthCheckEndpoint property is set as well, the following logic is applied: Only services will be returned where the HealthCheckEndpoint contains the Endpoint provided as sub-string (case invariant comparison is done).

member.summary: Class that acts as an entry point to the CM Proxy

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Session.MarshalEventsToSessionCreatorThread
member.summary: If true, all Events will be fired on the thread that created the Session. This is helpful if you use the Events to update the UI. In order for that to work correctly, you need a SynchronizationContext.Current when the Session is created (if this was done on the UI thread, then the SynchronizationContext.Current is there by default. The default value of this property is true.

member.summary: Current gateway computer name or IP. Used for notifications from CM service to this proxy (usually in a cluster environment).

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Session.s_currentCallbackGatewayPort
member.summary: Current gateway port for the callback endpoint. Used for notifications from CM service to this proxy (usually in a cluster environment).

member.summary: Current Endpoint of ConfigurationManager service

In order for that to work correctly, you need a SynchronizationContext.Current when the Session is created (if this was done on the UI thread, then the SynchronizationContext.Current is there by default. The default value of this property is true.

member.summary: Use this to access the Session

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.ConfigurationManager.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Session.CheckAliveFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the check alive frequency. If the setter has not been called yet, you get the value from EndpointHelper.CheckAliveFrequency. . When the setter is called, you can specifically set the frequency to some different value than the one in EndpointHelper.CheckAliveFrequency which is a global value. Must be set before the CM Session is created. The default value is 1 minute (60000).
